Welcome to MY_REST_API’s documentation!¶

MY_REST_API main¶

async main.ban_ips(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

Middleware to ban specific IP addresses.

main.read_root()¶

Root endpoint to test API availability.

async main.user_agent_ban_middleware(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

Middleware to ban requests based on user-agent header.

MY_REST_API repository Auth¶

class repository.auth.Hash¶

Bases: object

Class for handling password hashing.

Attributes pwd_context:

The context for hashing passwords using bcrypt. (CryptContext)

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Generates a hash for the given password.

Parameters:

password – The original password. (str)

Returns:

The hashed password. (str)

pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verifies the given plain password against the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – The original password. (str)

  • hashed_password – The hashed password. (str)

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise. (bool)

repository.auth.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates an access token.

Parameters:

  • data – The data to encode in the token. (dict)

  • expires_delta – The number of seconds until the token expires. (Optional[float])

Returns:

The encoded access token. (str)

repository.auth.create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data – The data to encode in the token. (dict)

  • expires_delta – The number of seconds until the token expires. (Optional[float])

Returns:

The encoded refresh token. (str)

async repository.auth.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves the current user based on the access token.

Parameters:

  • token – The access token. (str)

  • db – The database session. (Session)

Returns User:

The current user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the user is not found.

repository.auth.get_email_form_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Retrieves the email from the refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token – The refresh token. (str)

Returns:

The email extracted from the token. (str)

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or has an incorrect scope.

MY_REST_API repository Contacts¶

repository.contacts_crud.add_contact(db: Session, contact: ContactAdd, user_id: int)¶

Add a new contact.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session.

  • contact – Data of the new contact.

  • user_id – ID of the user who created the contact.

Returns:

The created contact.

repository.contacts_crud.all_contacts(db: Session, user_id: int, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100)¶

Retrieve all contacts of a user with pagination.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session.

  • user_id – ID of the user who created the contact.

  • skip – Number of contacts to skip (optional).

  • limit – Maximum number of contacts to return (optional).

Returns:

List of contacts.

repository.contacts_crud.del_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int)¶

Delete a contact.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session.

  • contact_id – ID of the contact to delete.

Returns:

The deleted contact or None if the contact was not found.

repository.contacts_crud.search_born_date(db: Session, user_id: int, born_date: date)¶

Search for contacts by birthdate.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session.

  • user_id – ID of the user who created the contact.

  • born_date – Birthdate for the search.

Returns:

List of contacts that match the criteria.

repository.contacts_crud.search_born_date_7days(db: Session, user_id: int)¶

Search for contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session.

  • user_id – ID of the user who created the contact.

Returns:

List of contacts that match the criteria.

repository.contacts_crud.search_contact(db: Session, user_id: int, contact_id: int = None, contact_firstname: str = None, contact_lastname: str = None, contact_email: str = None)¶

Search for a contact by specified criteria.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session.

  • user_id – ID of the user who created the contact.

  • contact_id – Contact ID (optional).

  • contact_firstname – Contact’s first name (optional).

  • contact_lastname – Contact’s last name (optional).

  • contact_email – Contact’s email (optional).

Returns:

The first found contact or None.

repository.contacts_crud.update_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate)¶

Update an existing contact.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session.

  • contact_id – ID of the contact to update.

  • contact – Data for updating the contact.

Returns:

The updated contact or None if the contact was not found.

MY_REST_API repository User¶

exception repository.users_crud.InvalidRefreshtoken¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when the refresh token is invalid.

exception repository.users_crud.LoginFailed¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when login fails due to incorrect credentials.

class repository.users_crud.UserService¶

Bases: object

Service class for handling user-related operations.

static check_password(entered_password: str, database_password: str)¶

Check if the entered password matches the database password.

Parameters:

  • entered_password – The entered password.

  • database_password – The database password.

Raises:

LoginFailed – If the password is incorrect.

Returns:

The user object if the password is correct.

static check_username_availablity(username: str, db: Session)¶

Check if a username (email) is available.

Parameters:

  • username – The user’s email.

  • db – Database session.

Raises:

UsernameTaken – If the username is already taken.

static confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirm a user’s email.

Parameters:

  • email – The user’s email.

  • db – Database session.

static creat_new_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

Create a new user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel containing the user’s data.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

static get_user(username: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

Retrieve a user by username (email).

Parameters:

  • username – The user’s email.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

The user object if found, else None.

static get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session)¶

Retrieve a user by email.

Parameters:

  • email – The user’s email.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

The user object if found, else None.

static login_user(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, db: Session)¶

Authenticate and log in a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm containing the login credentials.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

A tuple of access and refresh tokens.

Raises:

LoginFailed – If the login fails.

static refresh_token(refresh_token: str, db: Session)¶

Refresh an access token using a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • refresh_token – The refresh token.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

The new access token.

Raises:

InvalidRefreshtoken – If the refresh token is invalid.

static save_user(user_to_save, db: Session) → User¶

Save a user to the database.

Parameters:

  • user_to_save – The user object to save.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

The saved user.

static update_avatar(user: User, file: UploadFile, db: Session)¶

Update a user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • user – The user object.

  • file – The uploaded file containing the new avatar.

  • db – Database session.

Returns:

The updated user object.

exception repository.users_crud.UsernameTaken¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when the username is already taken.

MY_REST_API routes Contacts¶

routes.contacts.delete_contact(request: Request, contact_id: int, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Delete a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user – The current user, obtained via dependency injection.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

routes.contacts.new_add_contact(request: Request, contact: ContactAdd, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Add a new contact.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • contact – The contact data to add.

  • user – The current user, obtained via dependency injection.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact’s email is already registered.

Returns:

The added contact.

routes.contacts.read_contact_id(request: Request, contact_id: int, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user – The current user, obtained via dependency injection.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The retrieved contact.

routes.contacts.read_contact_search(request: Request, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), firstname: str = None, lastname: str = None, email: str = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Search for a contact by firstname, lastname, or email.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • user – The current user, obtained via dependency injection.

  • firstname – The firstname of the contact.

  • lastname – The lastname of the contact.

  • email – The email of the contact.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The retrieved contact.

routes.contacts.read_contacts(request: Request, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get all contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • user – The current user, obtained via dependency injection.

  • skip – The number of records to skip.

  • limit – The maximum number of records to return.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

routes.contacts.read_contacts_7days(request: Request, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • user – The current user, obtained via dependency injection.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Raises:

HTTPException – If no contacts are found with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

routes.contacts.read_contacts_born_date(request: Request, contacts_born_date: date, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get contacts by birth date.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • contacts_born_date – The birth date to search for.

  • user – The current user, obtained via dependency injection.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given birth date.

routes.contacts.update_contact(request: Request, contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact – The updated contact data.

  • user – The current user, obtained via dependency injection.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The updated contact.

MY_REST_API routes Users¶

async routes.users.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token – The confirmation token.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the verification fails or the email is already confirmed.

Returns:

A message indicating the email was confirmed.

async routes.users.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticate and login a user.

Parameters:

  • body – The login credentials.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is invalid or the email is not confirmed.

Returns:

The access and refresh tokens.

async routes.users.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh the access token using the refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – The authorization credentials.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Returns:

The new access and refresh tokens.

async routes.users.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Request email confirmation for a user.

Parameters:

  • body – The email request body.

  • background_tasks – Background tasks for asynchronous execution.

  • request – The request object.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Returns:

A message indicating the email was sent for confirmation.

async routes.users.send_test_email(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, email_to_send: str)¶

Send a test email.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • background_tasks – Background tasks for asynchronous execution.

  • email_to_send – The email address to send the test email to.

Returns:

None

async routes.users.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Register a new user.

Parameters:

  • body – The user data for registration.

  • background_tasks – Background tasks for asynchronous execution.

  • request – The request object.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the username is already taken.

Returns:

A message indicating the user was created and an email was sent for confirmation.

async routes.users.update_avatar_user(request: Request, file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update the user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object.

  • file – The uploaded avatar file.

  • current_user – The current user, obtained via dependency injection.

  • db – The database session, obtained via dependency injection.

Returns:

The updated user.

MY_REST_API servise Auth_service¶

services.auth_service.create_email_token(data: dict, SECRET_KEY='3rikCn67U63HhfmwTnSAK1mHwiEkvWLJ', ALGORITHM='HS256')¶

Create a JWT token with email verification data.

Parameters:

  • data – The data payload to be encoded in the token.

  • SECRET_KEY – Secret key for encoding the token (default from settings).

  • ALGORITHM – Algorithm for encoding the token (default from settings).

Returns:

Encoded JWT token as a string.

async services.auth_service.get_email_from_token(token: str, SECRET_KEY='3rikCn67U63HhfmwTnSAK1mHwiEkvWLJ', ALGORITHM='HS256')¶

Decode a JWT token to retrieve the email address (sub) from the payload.

Parameters:

  • token – The JWT token to decode.

  • SECRET_KEY – Secret key for decoding the token (default from settings).

  • ALGORITHM – Algorithm for decoding the token (default from settings).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

Returns:

The email address decoded from the token.

MY_REST_API servise Email¶

async services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, host: str)¶

Send an email for email verification.

Parameters:

  • email – The email address of the recipient.

  • host – The base URL of the application.

MY_REST_API utils Cloudinary¶

utils.cloudinary.upload_file_to_cloudinary(file, filename)¶

Uploads a file to Cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • file – The file to upload.

  • filename – The desired filename in Cloudinary.

Returns:

The URL of the uploaded file.
